law.catch_line: An appointing authority may use any appropriate selection process to rate qualified applicants....

section.section: An appointing authority may use any appropriate selection process to rate qualified applicants.
A unit must be able to establish the job relatedness, reliability, and validity of the selection tests that it uses.

A selection test must be:
free of charge; and
except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, open to all qualified applicants.

An appointing authority:
may disqualify and refuse to examine an otherwise qualified applicant who intentionally falsifies information in the application; and
shall give the applicant a written notice of the reason for the proposed disqualification.
An applicant who is disqualified under this subsection may submit a written response to the notice.
